messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Go (Golang) and the Gin (github.com/gin-gonic/gin) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `articles/routers.go`, I found that `ArticleCommentCreate` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/{slug}/comments`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path:
- /api/articles/{slug}/comments

All methods acceptable:
- false

HTTP methods acceptable (based on the code):
- HEAD: false
- POST: true
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- The root groups are created in main (hello.go): v1 := r.Group("/api") and then articles.ArticlesRegister(v1.Group("/articles")). Combining those gives the prefix /api/articles.
- In articles/routers.go, ArticlesRegister registers POST("/:slug/comments", ArticleCommentCreate). That yields the full POST path /api/articles/:slug/comments → represented with curly braces as /api/articles/{slug}/comments.
- ArticlesAnonymousRegister registers GET("/:slug/comments", ArticleCommentList) on the same /api/articles group, so GET on /api/articles/{slug}/comments is also defined.
- There is no router.Any or other wildcard registration that would allow all methods, so "All methods acceptable" is false.
- HEAD and OPTIONS are not explicitly registered anywhere in the code; per the instructions we do not make framework runtime assumptions, so they are marked false.
- DELETE is registered only as DELETE("/:slug/comments/:id", ArticleCommentDelete) — that is a different path (it requires an :id) and therefore does not make DELETE available on /api/articles/{slug}/comments.
- PUT, PATCH, TRACE are not registered for this path.
- Note: the POST handler is registered under the second v1.Use(users.AuthMiddleware(true)) group in main, so POST requires the authenticated middleware in the code, but that does not change that POST is the registered method.
